duration.description: Duration holds a realtime duration and a gametime duration.

gametimeMS.description: Gametime (Milliseconds) is a duration of milliseconds in game-world time.
gametimeMS.title: Gametime (Milliseconds)

realtimeMS.description: Realtime (Milliseconds) is a duration of milliseconds in real-world time.
realtimeMS.title: Realtime (Milliseconds)

duration.title: Duration

runTime.description: Run Time represents a moment inside a run, and indicates the duration of the run so far at that moment. It holds a realtime run duration so far and a gametime run duration so far.

gametimeMS.description: Gametime (Milliseconds) is a duration a run so far in milliseconds.
gametimeMS.title: Gametime (Milliseconds)

realtimeMS.description: Realtime (Milliseconds) is a duration of a run so far in milliseconds.
realtimeMS.title: Realtime (Milliseconds)

runTime.title: Run Time

description: The Splits.io Exchange Format is a specification for the transmission of runs between services and programs.

_schemaVersion.description: Specifies which version of the Splits.io Exchange Format the run was produced for. If you try to parse a run and this field doesn't validate, you probably need to update your Splits.io Exchange Format schema. All schemas accept any patch of an equivalent major-minor version, and any lesser minor version of an equivalent major version (e.g. v1.1.1 accepts v1.0.0, v1.1.0, and v1.1.2, but not v1.2.0 or v2.0.0). The exception is definition v1.0.0, which only accepts v1.0.0 runs.
_schemaVersion.title: Splits.io Exchange Format Version

attempts.description: Attempts contains historical information about previous runs by this runner in this category.

histories.description: Histories is an array of previous attempts by this runner of this category.

items.description: History is a single recorded attempt of this category by this runner.

attemptNumber.description: Attempt Number is the number of lifetime attempts the runner will have made after this one. The Attempt Number for an attempt is a label, not an index; the first attempt for a category has an Attempt Number of 1 (not 0).
attemptNumber.title: Attempt Number

items.title: History

histories.title: Histories

total.description: Total holds the total number of attempts for this category.
total.title: Total

attempts.title: Attempts

category.description: Category specifies information about the category being run.

links.description: Links specifies the category's identity in other services.

speedruncomID.description: Speedrun.com ID specifies the category's Speedrun.com ID.
speedruncomID.title: Speedrun.com ID

splitsioID.description: Splits.io ID specifies the category's Splits.io ID.
splitsioID.title: Splits.io ID

links.title: Links

longname.description: Longname is a human-readable category name, intended for display to users.
longname.title: Longname

shortname.description: Shortname is a machine-readable category name, intended for use in APIs, databases, URLs, and filenames.
shortname.title: Shortname

category.title: Category

endedAt.description: Ended At is the date and time at which the run was ended, specified in RFC 3339 format.
endedAt.title: Ended At

game.description: Game specifies information about the game being run.

links.description: Links specifies the game's identity in other services.

speedruncomID.description: Speedrun.com ID specifies the game's Speedrun.com ID.
speedruncomID.title: Speedrun.com ID

splitsioID.description: Splits.io ID specifies the game's Splits.io ID.
splitsioID.title: Splits.io ID

links.title: Links

longname.description: Longname is a human-readable game name, intended for display to users.
examples: The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time
longname.title: Longname

shortname.description: Shortname is a machine-readable game name, intended for use in APIs, databases, URLs, and filenames.
shortname.title: Shortname

game.title: Game

imageURL.description: Image URL is the location of an image associated with this run. Often this is a screenshot of the timer at run completion, but can be anything the runner wants displayed alongside the run.
imageURL.title: Image URL

links.description: Links specifies the run's identity in other services.

speedruncomID.description: Speedrun.com ID is the run's ID on Speedrun.com. This can be used to communicate with the Speedrun.com API.
speedruncomID.title: Speedrun.com ID

splitsioID.description: Splits.io ID is the run's ID on Splits.io. This can be used to communicate with the Splits.io API.
splitsioID.title: Splits.io ID

links.title: Links

pauses.description: Pauses holds runner-caused pauses that took place during the run.

items.description: Pause is a single pause that took place during the run.

endedAt.description: Ended At is the date and time at which the pause was ended, specified in RFC 3339 format.
endedAt.title: Ended At

startedAt.description: Started At is the date and time at which the pause was started, specified in RFC 3339 format.
startedAt.title: Started At

items.title: Pause

pauses.title: Pauses

runners.description: Runners is an array of people who participated in this run. Some games and categories call for cooperative play, but otherwise this will usually be just one person.

items.description: Runner describes one participant in the recorded run.

links.description: Links specifies the runner's identity in other services.

speedruncomID.description: Speedrun.com ID specifies the runner's Speedrun.com ID.
speedruncomID.title: Speedrun.com ID

splitsioID.description: Splits.io ID specifies the runner's Splits.io ID.
splitsioID.title: Splits.io ID

twitchID.description: Twitch ID specifies the runner's Twitch ID.
twitchID.title: Twitch ID

twitterID.description: Twitter ID specifies the runner's Twitter ID.
twitterID.title: Twitter ID

links.title: Links

longname.description: Longname is a human-readable runner name, intended for display to users.
longname.title: Longname

shortname.description: Shortname is a machine-readable runner name, intended for use in APIs, databases, URLs, and filenames.
shortname.title: Shortname

items.title: Runner

runners.title: Runners

segments.description: Segments is an array of all segments for this run, ordered from first to last.

items.description: Segment is one segment in this run.

histories.description: Histories is an array of previous completions of this segment by this runner.

items.description: History is a single recorded attempt of this segment by this runner.

attemptNumber.description: Attempt Number is the number of lifetime attempts the runner will have made on this category after this one. Generally these attempt numbers should correspond to those in Attempts -> History, although a number given here may not be present there if the run was reset before completion.
attemptNumber.title: Attempt Number

isReset.description: Is Reset should be true if the runner reset the run during this segment. If so, this and all future segments' Ended Ats for this run are ignored.
isReset.title: Is Reset

isSkipped.description: Is Skipped should be true if the runner skipped over the split that ends this segment, rather than splitting. If so, this segment's Ended At is ignored.
isSkipped.title: Is Skipped

items.title: History

histories.title: Histories

isReset.description: Is Reset should be true if the runner reset the run during this segment. If so, this and all future segments' Ended Ats for this run are ignored.
isReset.title: Is Reset

isSkipped.description: Is Skipped should be true if the runner skipped over the split that ends this segment, rather than splitting. If so, this segment's Ended At is ignored.
isSkipped.title: Is Skipped

name.description: Name is the runner-provided name of this segment
name.title: Name

items.title: Segment

segments.title: Segments

startedAt.description: Started At is the date and time at which the run was started, specified in RFC 3339 format.
startedAt.title: Started At

timer.description: Timer holds information about the timer used to record the run.

longname.description: Longname is a human-readable timer name, intended for display to users.
longname.title: Longname

shortname.description: Shortname is a machine-readable timer name, intended for use in APIs, databases, URLs, and filenames.
shortname.title: Shortname

version.description: Version is the version of the timer used to record this run. Semantic Versioning is strongly recommended but not enforced.
version.title: Version

website.description: Website is the URL for the timer's website.
website.title: Website

timer.title: Timer

videoURL.description: Video URL is the location of a VOD of the run.
videoURL.title: Video URL

title: Splits.io Exchange Format
